query='Describe the process and key strategies Felipe Aros employed in the development of the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex. Include details on how he ensured the precision of the system and the role of benchmarking in optimizing its performance.' contexts=['Felipe Aros
Santiago, Chile |569-98254228 |felipe.aros.r@gmail.com |github.com/felipearosr
Professional Summary
Results-driven professional with expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. Proven track record
in designing and implementing high-precision Retrieval-Augmented Generation systems, optimizing performance through
rigorous benchmarking. Experienced in engineering web applications and leading AI research projects with successful in-
ternational collaboration. Seeking opportunities to leverage skills in machine learning, software development, and project
leadership for innovative solutions and client satisfaction.
Experience
Generative AI - RAG Systems December 2022 – Present
Digitaltex Santiago, Chile
•Led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system for a prominent client, utilizing
a diverse dataset of over 100 documents to ensure unparalleled precision in information retrieval.
•Demonstrated expertise in grounding large language models (LLMs) on accurate and up-to-date information, sur-
passing client expectations and delivering a highly accurate RAG system.
•Conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple RAG system iterations, systematically analyzing and comparing per-
formance metrics to optimize efficiency and effectiveness.
•Fostered transparent collaboration with the client throughout the development and benchmarking phases, resulting
in a technically superior RAG system tailored to meet specific needs and expectations.
Machine Learning Engineer June 2022 – December 2022
Gecko Santiago, Chile
•Engineered a web application utilizing an in house ML model to accurately identify and mark road signs in images,
capturing their position, type, and direction.
•Implemented website optimization strategies to enhance overall user experience and performance.
•Executed responsive design principles across the entire web application, ensuring seamless usability across various
devices.
Customer Data Platform (CDP) Development Manager July 2021 – June 2022
Eureka Labs Santiago, Chile
•Led a team in the development and research of Customer Data Platform (CDP) tools, collaborating with international
providers for their implementation in national trade.
•Effectively communicated with software providers worldwide, fostering collaboration with teams from the United
States, Poland, and India.
•Managed and implemented new applications, contributing to improved documentation processes.
•Executed the implementation of diverse CDP services in various e-commerce settings.
Education
Universidad Diego Portales Santiago, Chile
Civil Engineering in Computer Science and Telecommunications Jan. 2018 – Dec. 2023
42 Silicon Valley San Francisco, USA
Study abroad in Computer Science Aug. 2014 – May 2018
Technical Skills
Languages : Python, Java, C/C++, SQL (Postgres), JavaScript, HTML/CSS
Frameworks : React, Node.js, Flask, FastAPI
Developer Tools : Git, Docker, TravisCI, Google Cloud Platform, VS Code, Visual Studio, PyCharm, IntelliJ, Eclipse
Libraries : pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib
Language Proficiency
Spanish : Native
English : Advanced (C1)'] response="Felipe Aros led the development of an advanced Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system at Digitaltex, employing a comprehensive approach to ensure the system's precision and optimize its performance. The process began with the utilization of a diverse dataset comprising over 100 documents. This extensive dataset was instrumental in grounding large language models (LLMs) on accurate and up-to-date information, which was a critical factor in surpassing client expectations and delivering a highly accurate RAG system.

To ensure the precision of the system, Aros demonstrated expertise in grounding the LLMs, which is essential for a RAG system as it relies on retrieving the most relevant information to generate accurate and contextually appropriate responses. This grounding process involved meticulously selecting and processing the dataset to ensure the information was both comprehensive and current, thereby enhancing the system's ability to provide precise outputs.

Benchmarking played a pivotal role in optimizing the performance of the RAG system. Aros conducted rigorous benchmarking of multiple iterations of the RAG system, systematically analyzing and comparing performance metrics. This methodical approach allowed for the identification of areas for improvement and the implementation of targeted optimizations. By comparing different iterations, Aros was able to refine the system's efficiency and effectiveness, ensuring that the final product not only met but exceeded the client's needs and expectations.

Throughout the development and benchmarking phases, Aros fostered transparent collaboration with the client. This collaborative approach ensured that the RAG system was tailored to meet the specific needs and expectations of the client, further contributing to the project's success. Through a combination of utilizing a diverse and accurate dataset, expert grounding of LLMs, rigorous benchmarking, and transparent client collaboration, Felipe Aros successfully led the development of a technically superior RAG system at Digitaltex." passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None

English : Advanced (C1)'] response="Felipe Aros's study abroad experience at 42 Silicon Valley likely played a significant role in shaping his expertise in Machine Learning Engineering and Software Development. This unique educational opportunity provided him with exposure to one of the world's leading technology hubs, known for its innovative culture and cutting-edge technological advancements. Being immersed in such an environment would have allowed him to engage with the latest software development practices, machine learning technologies, and industry trends firsthand.

The hands-on, project-based learning approach commonly adopted by institutions in Silicon Valley would have further honed his practical skills in coding, system design, and problem-solving. This experience is invaluable for someone specializing in areas as complex and dynamic as machine learning and software development. It would have equipped him with a solid foundation in various programming languages, development frameworks, and tools that are crucial for his field.

Moreover, the collaborative projects and interactions with a diverse set of peers and professionals in Silicon Valley would have enhanced his project leadership abilities. Working in such an innovative and fast-paced environment encourages the development of skills like effective communication, teamwork, and project management. These are essential for leading AI research projects and engineering web applications, as evidenced by his subsequent professional roles.

The global perspective gained from this study abroad experience, combined with the technical skills and leadership qualities developed, would have significantly contributed to his ability to lead successful international collaborations and deliver innovative solutions that meet client expectations. This background likely made him adept at navigating the challenges of developing high-precision systems like the Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems and implementing machine learning models in practical applications, as seen in his work history." passing=True feedback='YES' score=1.0 pairwise_source=None invalid_result=False invalid_reason=None
